content.text:
This is usually the version Noel does when he is playing an acoustic set.
For most chords, keep your ring finger and pinky on the B and high E strings
In the bridge, on the words 'revolution, 'had' and 'summertimes' slide your first finger to the first fret on
on the same string.
After the last two Cadd9 chords, when there is a * slide your first finger to the first fret again.

[Intro]
[ch]G[/ch] [ch]Cadd9[/ch] [ch]G[/ch] [ch]Cadd9[/ch]

[Verse 1]
[ch]G[/ch]               [ch]Dsus[/ch]        [ch]Em[/ch]
Slip inside the eye of your mind
          [ch]Em7[/ch]            [ch]Cadd9[/ch]    [ch]Dsus[/ch]
Don't you know you might find
                  [ch]G[/ch]     [ch]Em[/ch] [ch]D[/ch]
A better place to play
[ch]G[/ch]             [ch]Dsus[/ch]        [ch]Em[/ch]
You said that you'd never been
       [ch]Em7[/ch]                     [ch]Cadd9[/ch]   [ch]Dsus[/ch]
But all the things that you've seen
                 [ch]G[/ch]      [ch]Em[/ch] [ch]D[/ch]
Will slowly fade away

[Bridge]
[ch]Cadd9[/ch]                             [ch]G[/ch]
  So I start a revolution from my bed
           [ch]Cadd9[/ch]                            [ch]G[/ch]
'Cause you said the brains I had went to my head.
[ch]Cadd9[/ch]                           [ch]G[/ch]
  Step outside, summertime's in bloom
[ch]D[/ch]
Stand up beside the fireplace
[ch]B7[/ch]
Take that look from off your face
    [ch]Em[/ch]         [ch]D[/ch]             [ch]Cadd9[/ch]   [ch]D[/ch]
You ain't ever gonna burn my heart out

[Chorus]
    [ch]G[/ch]  [ch]Dsus[/ch]      [ch]Em[/ch]
And so Sally can wait,
   [ch]Em7[/ch]             [ch]Cadd9[/ch]          [ch]Dsus[/ch]      [ch]G[/ch]    [ch]Em[/ch] [ch]D[/ch]
she knows it's too late as we're walking on by
    [ch]G[/ch]    [ch]Dsus[/ch]   [ch]Em[/ch]
Her soul slides away,
[ch]Em7[/ch]               [ch]Cadd9[/ch]         [ch]Dsus[/ch]        [ch]G[/ch]
   but don't look back in anger I heard you say

[Break]

Chords Relative to Capo:

[ch]C[/ch]-x32010       [ch]Am[/ch]-x02210
[ch]F[/ch]-133211       [ch]G[/ch]-355433 (Bar Chord)

*Note* - When playing the "CFAmG" chord Progression, (for the F bar chord) you can remove your
 first finger (the bar) for the last down strum of the measure. You also do something similar on the G chord
(instead of removing bar, you slide down from G chord to the F chord on the last down strum)
ONLY NEED TO DO THIS FOR FLAIR AND TO SOUND CLOSER TO THE ACTUAL SONG

*2nd Note* - If you want to practice bar chords (or challenge yourself),
you can just remove the capo and play these chords:

[ch]Db[/ch]-x43121   [ch]Bb[/ch]-x13321
[ch]Gb[/ch]-244322   [ch]Ab[/ch]-466544

(Only made chords with capo on 1st because the [ch]Db[/ch] chord is a little difficult for some)

Hey everyone I'm not sure if this is completely like the original but of the 
versions i've tried on this site i think this sounds the best! I realize it is not 
in the original key but that can be adjusted by starting with capo 4 or simply 
transpose up 3 half steps. The key this is in works very well for female vocals, 
especially soprano. 

Since the key change can have some tricky chords, I did rate this as an 
intermediate level tab. However, you can get around this by moving the capo up a 
fret in the rest between "you are, you are, you are, you are..." and "don't wanna 
hear you say" and continue with the previous chords. 

Hope you guys like it please rate and comment!!
